  • Method Details

    • actionApptDelete

      public void actionApptDelete(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      The action event for the delete button. If no appointment is selected, the user will be presented with an error, and the user will be informed.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event for delete button

    • actionApptAdd

      public void actionApptAdd(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Action event for add button on appointment screen. When pressed - the user will be redirected to the add appointments screen.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - event for add button
      Throws:
      IOException - addresses unhandled exception

    • actionApptUpdate

      public void actionApptUpdate(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException, SQLException
      The action evebt for the update button on the appointment screen. If no appointment is selectedm the user will be presented with an error message. Once an appointment is selected, the user will be redirected to the modify appointment screen.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event for update button
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an unhandled exception
      SQLException - If there is an unhandled SQL exception.

      Parameters:

    • bckTomenu

      public void bckTomenu(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      The action event for button to return the user back to the main menu This method loads the Menu.fxml file and displays it as the main menu.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The action event triggere by the bckToMenu button.
      Throws:
      IOException - in case of unhandled exceptions during file loading.

    • monthlyAppts

    • weeklyAppts

      public void weeklyAppts(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Sets the items in the appointment table to the list of appointments for the next week. if there aren't appointments, sets a placeholder indicating that.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event that triggers the action.
